alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued April 20 at 12:05PM EDT until April 21 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT /11 PM CDT/ TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT /11 PM CDT/ tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although yellow flags are currently flying at Walton County beaches, surf heights are forecast to build up to 3 feet this afternoon, so the risk likely increases by then. The high rip current risk in Gulf County applies only to South- cape-facing (Indian Pass).
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
